00001 /*
00002  *******************************************************
00003  *              NOISE GENERATOR
00004  *******************************************************
00005  *              Tap.Tools Blue Object
00006  *              copyright © 2003 by Timothy A. Place
00007  *
00008  */
00009 
00010 // Check against redundant including
00011 #ifndef TT_NOISE_H
00012 #define TT_NOISE_H
00013 
00014 // Include appropriate headers
00015 #include "tt_audio_base.h"
00016 
00017 
00018 /********************************************************
00019         CLASS INTERFACE/IMPLEMENTATION
00020 
00021         The entire class is implemented inline for speed.
00022  ********************************************************/
00023 
00024 class tt_noise:public tt_audio_base{
00025 
00026         private:
00027                 // Function pointer for the DSP Loop (use this instead of branching for speed)
00028                 typedef void (tt_noise::*FuncPtr)(tt_audio_signal *);
00029                 FuncPtr dsp_executor;
00030 
00031                 // Attribute Values & Variables
00032                 tt_attribute_value_discrete     mode;
00033                 long                                                    noise_accum;
00034                 tt_sample_value                                 b0, b1, b2, b3, b4, b5, b6; // for the "pinking" filter
00035 
00036         
00037         public:
00038                 enum selectors{                                                                 // Attribute Selectors
00039                         k_mode,
00040                         k_mode_white,
00041                         k_mode_pink,
00042                         k_mode_brown,
00043                         k_mode_blue
00044                 };
00045                 
00046 
00047                 // OBJECT LIFE                                  
00048                 tt_noise()                                                                              // Constructor          
00049                 {
00050                         // set defaults
00051                         set_attr(k_mode, k_mode_white);
00052                         b0 = b1 = b2 = b3 = b4 = b5 = b6 = noise_accum = 0;
00053                 }
00054 
00055                 ~tt_noise()                                                                     // Destructor
00056                 {
00057                         ;
00058                 }
00059 
00060 
00061                 // ATTRIBUTES
00062                 void set_attr(tt_selector sel, tt_attribute_value val)  // Set Attributes
00063                 {
00064                         switch (sel){
00065                                 case k_mode:
00066                                         mode = (tt_attribute_value_discrete)val;
00067                                         if(mode == k_mode_white)
00068                                                 dsp_executor = &tt_noise::dsp_vector_calc_white;
00069                                         else if(mode == k_mode_pink)
00070                                                 dsp_executor = &tt_noise::dsp_vector_calc_pink;
00071                                         else if(mode == k_mode_brown)
00072                                                 dsp_executor = &tt_noise::dsp_vector_calc_brown;
00073                                         else if(mode == k_mode_blue)
00074                                                 dsp_executor = &tt_noise::dsp_vector_calc_blue;
00075                                         break;
00076                         }
00077                 }
00078 
00079                 tt_attribute_value get_attr(tt_selector sel)                            // Get Attributes
00080                 {
00081                         switch (sel){
00082                                 case k_mode:
00083                                         return mode;
00084                                 default:
00085                                         return 0.0;     // really should make this throw and exception (applies to all objects)!
00086                         }
00087                 }
00088                 
00089                 
00090                 /*****************************************************
00091                  * DSP LOOPS
00092                  *****************************************************/
00093                 
00094                 // Publically exposed interface for this object's dsp routine
00095                 void dsp_vector_calc(tt_audio_signal *out)
00096                 {
00097                         (*this.*dsp_executor)(out);     // Run the function pointed to by our function pointer
00098                 }
00099         
00100         private:
00101                 // DSP LOOP: WHITE
00102                 void dsp_vector_calc_white(tt_audio_signal *out)
00103                 {
00104                         temp_vs = out->vectorsize;
00105                     while (temp_vs--){
00106                                 // Generate white noise
00107                                 noise_accum = (noise_accum * 3877 + 29573) % 139968;    // Random number generator
00108                                 *out->vector++ = 1.0 - (2.0 * float(noise_accum) / 139968);             // Scale to audio range
00109                     }
00110                         out->reset();
00111                 }               
00112 
00113                 // DSP LOOP: PINK
00114                 void dsp_vector_calc_pink(tt_audio_signal *out)
00115                 {
00116                         tt_sample_value temp;
00117                         temp_vs = out->vectorsize;
00118                         
00119                     while (temp_vs--){
00120                                 // Generate white noise
00121                                 noise_accum = (noise_accum * 3877 + 29573) % 139968;    // Random number generator
00122                                 temp = 1.0 - (2.0 * float(noise_accum) / 139968);               // Scale to audio range
00123 
00124                                 // Pinking Filter
00125                                 b0 = 0.99886 * b0 + temp * 0.0555179;
00126                                 b1 = 0.99332 * b1 + temp * 0.0750759; 
00127                                 b2 = 0.96900 * b2 + temp * 0.1538520; 
00128                                 b3 = 0.86650 * b3 + temp * 0.3104856; 
00129                                 b4 = 0.55000 * b4 + temp * 0.5329522; 
00130                                 b5 = -0.7616 * b5 - temp * 0.0168980; 
00131                                 b6 = temp * 0.115926;
00132                                 temp = b0 + b1 + b2 + b3 + b4 + b5 + b6 + temp * 0.5362; 
00133 
00134                                 *out->vector++ = temp * 0.1;
00135                     }
00136                         out->reset();
00137                 }               
00138 
00139                 // DSP LOOP: BROWN
00140                 void dsp_vector_calc_brown(tt_audio_signal *out)
00141                 {
00142                         tt_sample_value temp;
00143                         temp_vs = out->vectorsize;
00144                         
00145                     while(temp_vs--){
00146                                 // Generate white noise
00147                                 noise_accum = (noise_accum * 3877 + 29573) % 139968;    // Random number generator
00148                                 temp = 1.0 - (2.0 * float(noise_accum) / 139968);               // Scale to audio range
00149 
00150                                 // "Browning" Filter
00151                                 temp = temp * 0.1;                                                                      // scale the white noise                        
00152                                 temp = clip(b1 + temp, float(-1.0), float(1.0));        // 6dB per octave lowpass
00153                                 b1 = temp;                                                                                      // store Feedback Sample
00154                                 *out->vector++ = temp * 0.25;                                           // output       
00155                     }
00156                         out->reset();
00157                 }               
00158 
00159                 // DSP LOOP: BLUE
00160                 void dsp_vector_calc_blue(tt_audio_signal *out)
00161                 {
00162                         tt_sample_value temp;
00163                         temp_vs = out->vectorsize;
00164                         
00165                     while (temp_vs--){
00166                                 // Generate white noise
00167                                 noise_accum = (noise_accum * 3877 + 29573) % 139968;    // Random number generator
00168                                 temp = 1.0 - (2.0 * float(noise_accum) / 139968);               // Scale to audio range
00169 
00170                                 // "Blue-ing" Filter
00171                                 temp = temp - b1;                                                                       // 6dB per octave highpass (real blue noise = 3dB/oct)
00172                                 temp = clip(temp, float(-1.0), float(1.0));                     // clip 
00173                                 *out->vector++ = temp;                                                          // output
00174                                 b1 = temp;                                                                                      // store feedback sample
00175                     }
00176                         out->reset();
00177                 }               
00178 
00179 };
00180 
00181 
00182 #endif          // TT_NOISE_H
